result.execSummary:
All charges against Brian Michael Peters in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Michael Peters is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Michael Peters

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney robert James mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Michael Peters in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brian Michael Peters. 
Court calls case. 
Atty spks on request for competency evaluation. 
Deft objects and argues. 
Atty spks responds. 
Deft confirms that he objects.
Court spks- advises deft that Atty is not the party that will determine whether or not he is competent to stand trial. 
Deft provided verbal motion that he wants Atty to withdraw.
Court denies that motion. 
Court finds probable cause and orders competency evaluation.
JT is removed from court calendar. 
Court schedules with parties. 
11:37 AM
Competency hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Notice of Use of CAD
